title: Tit-for-tat tussle between UK and EU continues as Brexit deadline looms
text:
Way back in July 2017 Boris Johnson, then the foreign secretary, said the EU could “go whistle” if it expected the UK to pay an outlandish Brexit divorce bill.

When asked at a press conference about Mr Johnson’s intervention, the EU’s chief negotiator Michel Barnier replied icily: “I’m not hearing any whistling, just the clock ticking.”

More than two years later, as the Brexit talks enter their latest final lap - the critical 72 hours ahead of this Thursday’s EU summit - it is once again the sound of a ticking clock that Mr Barnier wants Mr Johnson to hear.
